p.s: Acidaminococcaceae (A.ci.dam.in.o.coc.caâ€²ce.ae. N.L. masc. n. Acidaminococcus type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Acidaminococcaceae the Acidaminococcus family).
The family Acidaminococcaceae includes the recognized genera Acidaminococcus, Phascolarctobacterium, Succinispira and Succiniclasticum.
Cocci, or curved or pleiomorphic rods.
Carbohydrates are not fermented (with the exception of some Acidaminococcus fermentans strains for which weak fermentation of glucose is observed).
Growth with succinate or propionate production is observed or not.
Amino acids are used as energy source or not.
The type genus is Acidaminococcus Rogosa 1969.
